name: 1-phenylcyclohexanol
Reason: 1-phenylcyclohexanol has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is cyclohexanol, which has a melting point of 5.5°C (according to the CRC Handbook of Chemistry and Physics, 49th Edition, 1968-1969). The phenyl group introduces a rigid structure and additional molecular weight, estimated at +20°C. The cyclohexane ring introduces additional hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at +30°C. The methyl group reduces the melting point due to the reduced symmetry and molecular weight, estimated at -5°C.
